parameters.definition: The number of people an escalator can transport every minute
The number of people an elevator can transport every minute
The units of space an escalator takes up
The units of space an elevator takes up
The minimum number of people the airport needs to have the capacity to transport every minute
The ratio of the minimum number of escalators to elevators
The minimum number of elevators that must be used

description: An airport can either install escalators or elevators. Escalators can transport \param{EscalatorRate} people every minute whereas elevators can transport \param{ElevatorRate} people every minute. Escalators take up \param{EscalatorSpace} units of space while elevators take \param{ElevatorSpace} units of space. The airport needs to have enough capacity to transport at least \param{CapacityMinimum} people every minute. Additionally, there must be at least \param{EscalatorElevatorRatio} times more escalators than elevators and at least \param{ElevatorMinNumber} elevators must be used. How many of each type should the airport install to minimize the total units of space taken?
